Class CPUFireAI

  • java.lang.Object
    • CPUFireAI

  • class CPUFireAI
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CPUFireAI(BattleShipBoard b) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addHit(int x, int y)
      Adds a new hit and calls for alignment check.
      void calcAlign()
      After two hits this method is used to determine which way the ship is aligned.
      void checkOptions(int x, int y)
      Checks each square around x and y coordinates that can be fired at.

      Methods in Player class call this method for next shot.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CPUFireAI

        public CPUFireAI(BattleShipBoard b)

    • Method Detail

      • newHit

        public void newHit(int x,
                   int y)
        Called everytime a new hit is made to initiate "AI". Location of first hit is used for later shots.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate
        y - the y coordinate

      • guessTwoFirst

        public int[] guessTwoFirst()
        Called when there is one new hit. Method goes through all "neighbor" squares and checks wheter they are a valid target.
        Returns:
        array of x and y coordinates for next shot;

      • getShot

        public int[] getShot()
        Methods in Player class call this method for next shot. (x,y coordinates) Different method is used when there are more than one shot.
        Returns:
        array of x,y coordinates for next shot.

      • guessMore

        public int[] guessMore()
        Method is called when there are more than one shot. With two shots the alignment of ship is known so CPU can continue shooting in the correct axis.
        Returns:
        array of x,y coordinates for next shot.

      • calcAlign

        public void calcAlign()
        After two hits this method is used to determine which way the ship is aligned.

      • addHit

        public void addHit(int x,
                   int y)
        Adds a new hit and calls for alignment check. This is always a second hit. (First hit was made with newHit())
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of hit
        y - the y coordinate of hit

      • checkOptions

        public void checkOptions(int x,
                         int y)
        Checks each square around x and y coordinates that can be fired at. Used for debugging.
